HELP_CALCULATING_INTEREST.CALCULATE_THIS: To calculate this, use the steps bellow.

EXAMPLE.ANNUAL_INTEREST: the annual interest would be £80 (1000 x 0.08 = 80) you’d divide £80 by 365 to get the daily interest: about 22p a day (80 / 365 = 0.22) after 50 days this would be £11 (50 x 0.22 = 11)

STEPS.DAILY_INTEREST: Work out the daily interest: divide your yearly interest from step 1 by 365 (the number of days in a year).
STEPS.TOTAL_INTEREST: Work out the total amount of interest: multiply the daily interest from step 2 by the number of days the debt has been overdue.
STEPS.YEARLY_INTEREST: Work out the yearly interest: take the amount you’re claiming and multiply it by 0.08 (which is 8%).

HELP_CALCULATING_INTEREST.TITLE: Help calculating interest

ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.CONTINUE_HELP_WITH_FEES: Do you wish to continue to make a Help with Fees Application?
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.HELP_WITH_FEES: If you want to apply for Help with Fees, you will complete an online form in a new window. This will give you a reference number. Please note the number and keep it safe, as you will need it later in the claim process. (NB: if you have more than one claim going on, each claim must have a separate Help with Fees application and reference number). You can send in your claim as soon as you have the Help with Fees reference number, but the claim will not be issued until the Help with Fees application has been processed by the court. This is so that you will know what fees are covered and what you still have to pay. If you choose not to pay, the claim will not be issued. The claim will stop here unless you change your mind within 95 days.
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.HELP_WITH_FEES_ADVICE: You may be asked by the court to email evidence in support of your application before your claim is issued.
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.HELP_WITH_FEES_INTRO: Making an application for Help with Fees does not guarantee that you will get your fee covered. You may still have to pay some or all of your court fee to get the claim issued (for the court system to officially start the claim and send details to the other side). When you apply for Help with Fees, you should receive an update from us within 5 working days, giving you the result of your application.
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.TITLE: Some useful information about Help with Fees

EXPERT_DETAILS.TELL_US_WHY_NEED_EXPERT: Tell us why you need this expert

EXPERT_GUIDANCE.ASK_PERMISSION: You must ask for permission to use an expert - a judge will then decide whether the expert is necessary.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.COST_HIRING_EXPERT: The cost of hiring an expert depends on which expert you and the {{ otherParty }} choose.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.EXPERT_REPORT: The expert will provide a written report - they won't usually come to court in person.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.FOR_EXAMPLE: For example, they might allow a structural engineer to be used in a claim about building works or a mechanic in a claim about car repairs.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_JUDGE_ALLOWS: If a judge allows you to use an expert, you'll usually have to share one expert with the {{ otherParty }}.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_PERMISSION: If you get permission to use an expert
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_YOU_WIN: If you win the case you may be able to recover a maximum of £750 of the cost you paid. A judge will rule on this at the end of the hearing.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_ALLOW_EXPERT: A judge will only allow you to use an expert if they believe they need the expert's specialist knowledge.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_DECIDE_COST: The judge will also decide whether the cost of the expert is reasonable compared to the value of the claim.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_MAY_ASK: The judge may ask one of you to make a list of 3 independent experts who can provide a written report in return for a fee.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGES_RESPONSIBLE_COST: Even though you and the {{ otherParty }} share the cost of hiring the expert, judges are still responsible for keeping costs in proportion to value.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.MUST_AVOID_DISCUSSING: You must avoid discussing the case in detail with the 3 experts.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.OTHER_PARTY_CHOOSES: The other party then chooses one expert from the list. After that, you both need to follow these steps
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PAY_EXPERT: Pay the expert - you usually both share this cost.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PROVIDE_EXTRA: Provide any extra information the expert asks for.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PROVIDE_QUESTIONS: Provide questions for the expert to answer in a report.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.RARE: It's rare for judges to allow you to use an expert in a small claim.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.SEND_EXPERT_REPORT: Send the expert's report to the court (only one of you will have to do this).
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.TITLE: Using an expert in small claims
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.USUALLY_SHARE_COST: Usually you both share this cost.

FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.SUBTITLE: If you don't respond
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.TITLE: Respond to a money claim
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_1: You have 28 days to respond to the claim from the date the court issued it.
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_2: Find the exact deadline date in the letter or email you received explaining the claim.
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_3: We'll send your response to the claimant (the person or organisation who says you owe them money).
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_4_PART_1: The claimant can apply for a
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_4_PART_2: against you if you don't respond before the deadline.
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_5: They can use a CCJ to get the money from you, for example by applying to the court to send bailiffs to your home or business.
FIRST_CONTACT_SIGNPOSTING.PARAGRAPH_6: A CCJ may make it harder to get credit, such as a mobile phone contract, credit card or mortgage.

FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.AUTOMATICALLY_REGISTERED: We have automatically registered you for free telephone mediation from HM Courts and Tribunals Service.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.CLAIMANT_MUST_AGREE: The claimant must agree to mediation. We'll contact you within 28 days after the claimant's confirmation, to arrange a free appointment.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.DO_NOT_AGREE_TO_FREE_MEDIATION: I do not agree to free mediation
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.EITHER_PARTY_BREAKS_TERMS: If either party breaks the terms the other party can go to court to ask for a judgment or hearing.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.LAST_LESS_AN_HOUR: Your mediation appointment will last for no more than an hour.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_SUCCESSFUL: If mediation is successful, you'll make a verbal agreement over the phone. This is legally binding which means that you must comply with it. You will be given the terms of the agreement in a document – this is called a settlement agreement.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_IS_CONFIDENTIAL: Mediation is confidential, and nothing said in the mediation can be used in court proceedings if the dispute cannot be settled. The mediator speaks to each party separately, this is not a conference call.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_FAILS: If mediation fails and a court hearing is needed, what happened during the mediation appointment cannot be mentioned in court.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_QUICKER: Mediation can be quicker, cheaper and less stressful than going to court.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.NO_AGREE: I do not agree to free mediation
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.NEUTRAL_MEDIATOR_LISTEN: A trained, neutral mediator from HM Courts and Tribunals Service will listen to your views and help you to negotiate a settlement of your dispute.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.NO_WAIT_COURT_HEARING: You will not have to wait longer for a court hearing if you choose mediation.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.OPENS_IN_NEW_TAB: free telephone mediation (opens in new tab).
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.TITLE: Free telephone mediation

ERRORS.VALID_AMOUNT_ONE_POUND_OR_MORE: Enter an amount of £1 or more
ERRORS.VALID_AT_LEAST_ONE_OPTION: You must select at least one option
ERRORS.VALID_CLAIM_INTEREST_FROM: Choose when to claim interest from
ERRORS.VALID_CLAIM_INTEREST_END_DATE: Choose when you want to stop claiming interest
ERRORS.VALID_DATE_NOT_IN_PAST: Enter a date that is today or in the future

VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.COUNCIL_TAX: Enter a valid Council Tax or Community Charge amount, maximum two decimal places
VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.ELECTRICITY: Enter a valid Electricity amount, maximum two decimal places
VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.GAS: Enter a valid Gas amount, maximum two decimal places
VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.MAINTENANCE: Enter a valid Maintenance Payments amount, maximum two decimal places
VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.MORTGAGE: Enter a valid Mortgage amount, maximum two decimal places
VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.RENT: Enter a valid Rent amount, maximum two decimal places
VALID_DEBT_AMOUNT.WATER: Enter a valid Water amount, maximum two decimal places

ERRORS.VALID_DISAGREE_REASON_REQUIRED: Enter text explaining why do you disagree
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_AT_LEAST_ONE_COURT_ORDER: Enter at least one court order
ERRORS.VALID_ENTER_AT_LEAST_ONE_NUMBER: Enter a number for at least one field
ERRORS.VALID_FREE_TEXT_DATE_LENGTH: Enter a date no longer than $constraint1 characters
ERRORS.VALID_CANT_ATTEND_HEARING: Select yes if there are any dates in the next 12 months when you, your experts or witnesses cannot go to a hearing
ERRORS.VALID_NUMBER_FOR_PREVIOUS_PAGE: Number can’t be higher than on previous page
ERRORS.VALID_PHONE_NUMBER: Enter a phone number in the correct format

VALID_PHONE_OR_VIDEO_HEARING.TELL_US_WHY: Tell us why you want a telephone or video hearing
VALID_PHONE_OR_VIDEO_HEARING.YES_NO: Select yes if you want to ask for a telephone or video hearing

ERRORS.VALID_REQUEST_EXTRA_4_WEEKS: Select yes if you want an extra 4 weeks to try to settle the claim
ERRORS.VALID_SENT_EXPERT_REPORTS: Select yes if you have sent expert reports to the other parties
ERRORS.VALID_SHARED_EXPERT: Select yes if you want to share an expert with the claimant
ERRORS.VALID_TRIED_TO_SETTLE: Select yes if you have tried to settle this claim before going to court
ERRORS.VALID_TWO_DECIMAL_NUMBER: Enter a valid amount, maximum two decimal places
ERRORS.VALID_VALUE: Are you sure this is a valid value?
ERRORS.VALID_WHY_FROM_PARTICULAR_DATE: You need to explain why you are claiming
ERRORS.QUESTION_1_REQUIRED: Select yes if someone is vulnerable in a way that the court needs to consider
ERRORS.QUESTION_2_REQUIRED: Tell us who is vulnerable and what support they need
